content.webTitle: Gloucester 55-0 Brive | European Challenge Cup Pool 5 match report

fields.headline: Charlie Sharples scores three tries in Gloucester thrashing of Brive
fields.bodyText: Gloucester ran in seven tries, including a hat-trick for the wing Charlie Sharples, to launch their European Challenge Cup campaign with a 55-0 thrashing of Brive. The home side were in control at half-time but leading by only 10 points before a second-half barrage submerged the French side, earning Gloucester a bonus point in the tournament that replaced the Amlin Challenge Cup. Sharples opened the scoring in the 15th minute on his 150th appearance for Gloucester and he proved a handful for the Brive defence throughout with his speed . It was one-way traffic to the Brive tryline after the flyhalf James Hook scored five minutes after the break – his first try for the club. Both sides saw yellow early in the second period after an incident involving the props Yann Thomas and Damien Jourdain. The Gloucester scrum-half, Greg Laidlaw, kicked two penalties and three conversions before being replaced after 50 minutes by Dan Robson, who earned his 72nd-minute try with a commanding performance. The scoring was completed with a penalty try in the final minute after the exhausted Brive pack splintered, which was converted by Rob Cook, his third of the evening. “In the second half they got a bit tired and the quality of our outside backs came through, “ said David Humphreys, the Gloucester director of rugby.
